content: 1 and 4 of each pattern omitting rounds 2 and 3 initial repeat of pattern round 1 join colour b and knit all stitches on needle 1 one quarter of the stitches drop colour b join colour c and knit all stitches on needle 2 second quarter of the stitches drop colour c join colour d and knit all stitches on needle 3 third quarter of the stitches drop colour d join colour e and knit all stitches on needle 4 last quarter of the stitches bring yarn forward slip first stitch on needle 1 to needle 4 bring yarn back slip_stitch back to needle 1 turn work round 2 using colour e purl all stitches on needle 4 drop colour e so that it rests over colour d pick up colour d from under colour e so that the two strands of yarn form a twist purl all stitches on needle 3 drop colour d so that it rests over colour c pick up colour c from under colour d forming a twist purl all stitches on needle 2 drop colour c so that it rests over colour b pick up colour b from under colour c forming a twist purl to last stitch on needle 1 at this point you can either pick up the wrapped stitch and purl it together with the last stitch on the needle or leave it where it is and purl the last stitch on it s own leaving the wrap creates a flatter seam knitting the wrap creates a neater looking seam your choice this is done at the end of every round purl on a purl round knit on a knit round bring yarn to back slip last stitch on needle 4 to needle 1 bring yarn forward slip_stitch back to needle 4 turn work round 3 as for round 1 twisting the strands of yarn as you change colours round 4 as for round 2 except needle 1 as follows purl to one stitch before the end of needle 1 bring yarn to back slip 1 bring yarn forward slip same stitch back turn work each repeat of the pattern from now on will move the start of round 1 stitch to the left needles 1 and 2 will remain as the underside of the foot and needles 3 and 4 the top of the foot irrespective of where the start of the round is located all subsequent repeats of pattern round 1 continuing with colour b knit 1/4 of the total number of stitches if you are following this pattern it will be 17 stitches twist colour b and c knit the second 1/4 of the stitches with colour c twist colour c and d knit the third 1/4 of the stitches with colour d twist colour d and e knit the third 1/4 of the stitches with colour e picking up and knitting the wrapped stitch if you so choose bring yarn forward slip 1 bring yarn back
